name: Africa House Malawi
description: Whether a tourist, business person or transit visitor, all come to appreciate the Africa House​'s tasteful and comfortable accommodation, warm hospitality and excellent collection of African arts and crafts. The lodge offers a range of different rooms, all en-suite, and a restaurant for residents. During many years of experience and travel throughout Africa​, the owners collected traditional arts and crafts; this collection shows how traditional cultures make use of locally available materials. Whether the material that is used is wood, stone, beads, paint, metal, fabric or leather, African people continue to make powerful statements about their cultures and create an extraordinary and rich heritage of artistic expression. A stylish contemporary lodge has been created from a unique blend of African designs, furniture, fabrics and personal collectables. Each room is named after an African country, style or culture and decorated to reflect that. This and a work experience of over 20 years ​in the tourism and hospitality industry have made Africa House Malawi a true destination with a difference.

name: Mufasa Eco Lodge
description: Have you been searching for heaven on earth or an exotic place or simply a place to chill.....Mufasa Eco Lodge situated in Monkey Bay has it all.... As you enter this stunning place, take your time and climb "Jam Rock" on your left, takes just 2 min. and explore in an almost 360 degree view, what Mother Nature has created at a secluded spot at Lake Malawi. The majestic silence and the soft breeze will only be interrupted by chirping birds, the call of the fish eagle, the sound of the warm and inviting crystal clear water and everything else you expect in paradise. Don't forget your camera to take the first pictures and see what you let yourself into over the coming days.... or come back for a romantic sunset with a glass of wine or an ice cold beer. After this first amazing impression our friendly staff will warmly welcome you and show you around. From the bar to the restaurant with an all day menu, to the chill out area, you will feel that you have just arrived at the right spot at the right time. The campsite built on different levels in the shade of the mountain flora and the marvelous view over the beach site and its unique surrounding invites you to become an explorer as one camp spot is built in a small cave. You prefer a decent bed and a roof above your head. We offer Double, Twin, Single and Dorm Rooms right on the beach, cozily furnished, with solar lighting and mosquito netting. A local mosaic artist ensured that you will enjoy your hot or cold shower any time of the day or night. Next to our restaurant we offer a braai area for those who like to cook for themselves. The soft solar lighting will ensure that you find your way at night, without disturbing the fire sparks floating up in the air or the ability to see that the stars do shine brighter over Africa. This will be the moment of truth, when you realize that this place can heal the weary traveler's body and soul and revitalize the spirit. There is lot's to do at Mufasa Monkey Bay..... - Bird watching, over 140 different species has been counted. - Snorkling - we have a large variety of chiclets, a tropical fish species, unique to Lake Malawi around the shore of the cosy little cove that we are locate in. - Hiking, cycling, rock climbing (and jumping) along the lake shores. - Take a hike to the end of the mainland, - Take a mountain hike and visit one of our friendly fisherman's villages, which can only be reached by boat or over the mountains. - Take a boat trip to Monkey Island and explore it or explore the waters around it, in the spectacular Chiclet world, a colorful tropical fish species, unique to Lake Malawi. - Take a stroll to Monkey Bay the village (approx. 10 min. walk) where you can find anything from a sound system to vegetables on the market. - Visit the Monkey Bay harbor and experience the Malawi fisherman coming and going for their daily toil or experience the administration of justice in the local district court situated at the harbor - Take a motor bike taxi, Motola or boat and spend the day in Cape Maclear - Climb "Jam Rock" at sunset for a sun downer, whilst sighting Hippo's in the Presidential Bay - Take a boat trip around to the harbor and three remote fisherman villages which can only be reached on foot or by boat - Just enjoy the day at the beach and swim or simply hang out at our lovely and unique new beach bar - Boarding for the well renowned, historical, Ilala passenger ship, visiting Metangula in Mozambique, Likoma Island (Malawi), Tanzania and Nkhata Bay, is only 10 minutes, walk from Mufasa Monkey Bay - The spectacular Liwonde Game Reserve is only a few hours away. Busses or other transport available daily Mobiles, laptops etc can be charged at a provided solar charger. .....you still need more to be convinced? Just pop in and see for yourself.

name: Kuti Wildlife Reserve
description: Kuti Wildlife Reserve is located in central Malawi. This nation is known as ‘The Warm Heart of Africa’, both for its stunning beauty and friendly people. Kuti is home to a variety of animals native to this area. Although no dangerous predators live here, there are plenty of animals such as zebra, eland, monkeys, giraffe and a great variation of birds. The absence of dangerous game makes the park accessible on foot or by bicycle, which gives you a unique and up-close experience with the bush. ​ Besides sharing the beauty of nature, Kuti Wildlife Reserve is important for the local communities. We raise awareness about ecology and support community projects. By changing local perceptions of wildlife, we hope to preserve wildlife for future generations. ​ Visit Kuti and experience the unique tranquillity of the African bush!

name: Leslie Lodge
description: Originally a small holding of pine trees and then home to Ray and Lynne Finch and their three children, in their iconic Tudor house that Ray himself designed, Leslie Lodge quietly grew one room at a time. As Lynn welcomed business professionals to stay, helping them navigate the city and surrounds she made her mark by feeding them at their family table. The lodge has many chapters of stories to tell as it grew not only in size but in reputation, with a common thread existing in all of them – adventures in Blantyre, forging friendships, warm happy and accommodating Malawians and last but most important, genuine honest and kind people offering warm hospitality. Leslie Lodge has become a much loved ‘home away from home’ for many local and international travellers over the years and a well-known iconic landmark within the city.

name: Njaya Lodge
description: Opened for business on Christmas Day 1993, Njaya Lodge was built as a labour of love in cooperation with the people of our adopted home. In fact, many of the staff who helped build Njaya and make it what it is today, are still there extending their typical Malawian warmth, humour and character to all our guests. Nestled into the side of a hill, and overlooking magnificent Lake Malawi, we've built a collection of chalets and houses spread over lush gardens and terraces that lead down to beautiful Chikale beach, the only beach in Nkhata Bay. There should be something to fit every budget, from brand new cottages perched over the water, to family houses and garden chalets, all ensuite with four poster mosquito-netted beds, fans and views. "The kind of place you could wake up in one morning and realise that you were supposed to be back at work months ago" from the book, 'Swahili for the Broken Hearted' by Peter More (Bantam Books).

name: Mulanje Pepper Pizza
description: In the last year Jungle Pepper and its popular brand has opened another branch in Mulanje naming it the Mulanje Pepper. Mulanje Pepper is situated at the foot of Mulanje Mountain, the country’s premier hiking and rock-climbing destination, popular with residents and tourists alike for its dramatic scenery and well organized and inexpensive facilities. Around mid-July the Mulanje Porters’ Race takes place in Mulanje. It is now an International Event whereby Porters and other entrants race up and down 25km of steep mountain in one of Africa’s maddest and most daunting fitness challenges.Mulanje Pepper has become the visitor and hiker’s oasis, offering the coldest drinks and the most exquisite wood-flavoured pizzas.Visit us and let Mulanje Pepper take you on a trip through the History of the area by the choice of pizza you make! Pizzas have names of historical significance and of interesting places one can visit in Malawi. Mwala wa Mthunzi Pizza, Dziwe La Nkalamba Pizza, Mtenga-Tenga Pizza, Sapitwa Pizza, Timba Pizza, Cedar Pizza, Chiperoni Pizza, Katundu Pizza and off course the Porter's Pizza which has toppings of tasty Portuguese flavoured chicken, green peppers, onions and Cheese. Customers who don’t know what the name refers to, can refer to the back of the Menu where they will find an explanation of what they have ordered.We are recognised by Trip Advisor. Also follow us on Facebook and Twitter.

name: Blantyre Sports Club
description: Blantyre sports club was established in 1896. It is a member’s club with annual, monthly and day membership available. The club has a 30 meter swimming pool, 9 hole golf course, 5 tennis courts, 2 squash courts, a gym, banquet hall, darts room, snooker tables, a bar, 2 family restaurants plus 2 grounds used for social ruby and soccer. The club has a very rich heritage. Members enjoy reciprocal membership with Limbe country club, Lilongwe golf club. Mulanje Club, Mzuzu club, Sucoma club,Kamuzu Academy Thyolo club, Kasasa club and Zomba Gymkhana club in Malawi. At the same time it has reciprocity membership with select clubs in Zambia, Zimbabwe, Kenya, Botswana,and South Africa. name: Mkulumadzi Lodge - Robin Pope Safaris
description: Majete Wildlife Reserve is one of the outstanding success stories of African conservation. Granted protected status in 1955, it became the subject of extensive poaching in the 1980s and 1990s. But a concerted joint effort since 2003 by the African Parks Network and the Malawi government - including the reintroduction of endangered species - has turned it into a model of sustainable development and biodiversity. In 2012 Majete became Malawi’s only Big Five Park. Located in the south of Malawi, Majete is an area of 70.000 hectares, part of Africa’s Great Rift Valley. The reserve is made up of mature miombo woodlands and granite topped hills that contrast with picturesque river valleys and lush riverine forest. For connoisseurs of wildlife many exciting encounters lie in store, with the chance to view many species including black rhino, leopard, lion, elephant, buffalo, eland, kudu, sable, suni, klipspringer, Lichtenstein’s hartebeest and zebra. Surrounded by 7,000 hectares of private concession, Mkulumadzi enjoys an idyllic location at the confluence of two rivers shaded by giant leadwood trees. It is the perfect combination of splendid isolation and first-class facilities. The lodge has eight superb chalets, each with spacious living quarters and private viewing deck. Guests can swim in our pool, dine under the stars, enjoy river cruises, game drives and walking safaris. Undiscovered by tourists, Majete is a true wilderness where every trip into the bush with our team of experienced guides will feel like an adventure. Guests arrive by a footbridge suspended over the Mkulumadzi River to discover a friendly welcome and many home comforts. The lodge has a restaurant with indoor and outdoor dining, a lounge and terrace, a bar and shop, swimming pool, viewing deck and a lapa for evening campfires. The perfect combination of luxury and isolation, Mkulumadzi boasts eight superb chalets set on the banks of the Shire River, shaded by giant leadwood trees and wild mangos. Each chalet has a spacious bedroom and lounge, ensuite bathroom, outdoor shower and private viewing deck where guests can sit back and marvel at the sights and sounds of the river. The bush chalets are luxurious and spacious with contemporary furnishings, some crafted from locally-sourced materials. They are flooded with natural light, giving you the sense of being in the forest without compromising your comfort and privacy. There is also an outdoor shower with a large rain shower where guests can enjoy the sensation of bathing under a waterfall. The shower is open to the surrounding bush with stone-clad walls for privacy. Each chalet has a sloping vegetated roof planted with indigenous species such as succulents, aloes, shrubs and grasses. This minimises their impact on the environment and keeps them cool in the hot season. Game drives and walking safaris are offered in the mornings and late afternoons, giving guests plenty of time to relax beside the pool, gaze at the resident bird population or listen to the grunt of hippos wallowing in the river. Afternoon tea is served on the terrace and on most nights dinner is served beneath the stars.

Its extensive wildlife library and telescope make the most of the exceptional bird and other life that moves around the river, and the pool is perfect for cooling off at siesta time. Highlights In this lush area, the Shire and its floodplains draw an excellent diversity of animals to feed and drink, including a dense population of hippo, crocodiles and large numbers of elephant as well as sable, Lichtenstein's hartebeest, yellow baboon and waterbuck. No visit is complete without meeting the friendly people of the nearby villages.

A WILD ISLAND PARADISE: the exclusive Blue Zebra Island Lodge is situated on Nankoma Island within Lake Malawi National Park (UNESCO World Heritage site). Unobtrusive and eco-friendly, operating on solar power.

Offering a unique and sustainable travel experience, Blue Zebra is a conservation driven lodge working with the Department of National Parks and Wildlife in Malawi to protect three islands making up the Marelli group: Nankoma, Maleri, and Nakantenga. These uninhabited islands are home to a vast array of fresh water fish, including some of the most rare and colourful in the world. They support diverse flora and fauna and are a bird watcher's paradise. 

Accommodation: a unique set-up with 9 en-suite safari-style tented chalets, 1 forest-set Pitta Cottage, and 1 Superior Family Cottage overlooking Lake Malawi. Secluded executive chalets boast stunning views from private balconies, some with lake access. The chalets are set in an unspoiled environment, immersed in nature. 

Facilities: spa, infinity pool, cocktail bar, restaurant, games room, meetings room, curio shop.

Activities: nature trails, birding, kayaking, snorkeling, water-sports, sunset cruise.

Just a 2 hour drive from Lilongwe, this is a great combination with Zambian Safaris as well as various wildlife parks in Malawi.

We invite you to come and have dinner or a drink, spend the night in a tent, our dorm or a private room. In our common areas and our garden you will meet Malawians and people from all over the world traveling through Zomba! We offer Paka Tours; from guided walks up Zomba Plateau to airport transfers and trips to Mulanje, Liwonde, Cape Maclear or even as far as Nkhata Bay. Our local guide Isaac is a gem. He knows the area very well and can tell you all about nature on the mountain and the culture of Malawian people. The owners are happy to share their extensive knowledge of the country. If you are just arriving in Malawi, we offer a landing package with an airport transfer, information about the country (money/ATMs, transport, places to visit, dos & don'ts), a local SIM card & a Malawian G&T, soft drink or cold 'green' (beer) on arrival at our lodge. At the moment our restaurant is open every day from 7AM until 8PM.

name: Hotel Victoria
description:
Finding an ideal small hotel in Blantyre does not have to be difficult. Welcome to Hotel Victoria, a nice option for travelers like you.
Guest rooms offer air conditioning and a refrigerator, and Hotel Victoria makes getting online easy as free wifi is available.
You can also take advantage of some of the amenities offered by the small hotel, including room service. In addition, guests can enjoy a pool and an on-site restaurant during their visit.
Close to St Michael and All Angels Church (1.6 mi), a popular Blantyre landmark, Hotel Victoria is a great destination for tourists.
Blantyre has plenty of Indian restaurants. So when you’re here, be sure to check out popular spots like Bombay Palace and Veg- Delight, which are serving up some great dishes.
Looking to explore? Then look no further than La Caverna Art Gallery (0.5 mi) and Malawi Stock Exchange (0.1 mi), which are some popular Blantyre attractions – all conveniently located within walking distance of the small hotel.
Hotel Victoria puts the best of Blantyre at your fingertips, making your stay both relaxing and enjoyable.

name: Mango Drift Lodge - Hostel
description: Mango Drift is a backpackers lodge located on the west side of Likoma Island on the beautiful waters of Lake Malawi. Situated on an expansive and private stretch of beach Mango Drift has to be one of the most scenic places to stay on the island. There are a number of en-suite and standard beach chalets located along the beach; as well as an en-suite dormitory and camping facilities. The two en-suite mid-range chalets are slightly set back on the hillside, with private bathrooms and beautiful verandas. Under a big Mango tree is the bar and restaurant offering a full range of drinks including cold beers, soft drinks and an extensive assortment of local and imported spirits. Choose from the wide selection of food items from the breakfast and lunch menu. Dinner is a set menu each night from a delicious meal prepared by our kitchen staff. Relax on the Mango beach enjoy the lake or play a game of pool or volleyball on the beach. Or if you want to do something more exciting, Mango Drift offers a range of water sports from wakeboarding to waterskiing, Scuba Diving and even learn to Kite Surf on the only known school on the lake. Learn to dive with our fully qualified PADI dive instructors, with courses to suit all levels, from those first bubbles up to professional Divemaster. Learn to dive in the crystal clear waters of Lake Malawi and see the abundance of life that Likoma Island has to offer.
address: West side of the Island, Likoma Island Malawi

name: Sunbird Hotels and Resorts
description: Situated within Majete around a serene floodlit waterhole that attracts a variety of wildlife, Sunbird Thawale Lodge is a peaceful haven from which to experience Majete. Completely unfenced, the camp is regularly visited by wildlife. Sunbird Thawale Lodge offers six double and twin tented chalets all en-suite and each with its own private veranda overlooking the waterhole. The more luxurious chalet has a unique open air bathroom built among the rocks with a shower and a sunken bath and views of the floodlit waterhole. The chalets are spaced out to offer visitors privacy and an individual bush experience. A communal lapa (traditional lounge area) with a fully staffed kitchen is available in the centre of the camp. Fresh meals are served in the beautiful thatched bamboo restaurant and bar with a birding veranda. Sunbird Thawale is fully electrified.

name: Huntingdon House
description: Arguably the most scenically beautiful region of Malawi, The Thyolo district forms the heart of Malawi's tea producing region with rolling hills of immaculately cultivated, emerald green plantations and some of the oldest estates in the country. With magnificent views of Mount Mulanje and the Lower Shire valley to the west, Satemwa enjoys a temperate climate of the Shire Highlands and relaxed ambiance of a by-gone era. Visitors to this corner of Malawi cannot but help to be caught up in the colonial magic of the area and diverse scenery which ranges from tropical evergreen forests to riverine thickets and rolling hills. Huntingdon House was built in the 1920's and the estate has been in the Cathcart Kay family for generations with members of the family still running the tea and coffee production of the estate. The grand old colonial style house has been tastefully restored as a joint venture between the Satemwa Tea Estate and the Ulendo Travel Group.
address: Satemwa Tea Estate PO Box 6, Thyolo Malawi

name: Pumulani Lodge - Robin Pope Safaris
description: Situated on the west side of the Nankumba Peninsula on the Southern end of Lake Malawi you can find Pumulani subtly nestled in the lush hills amongst the trees and craggy outcrops. The ten villas with their grass roofs to help reflect the heat provide the ultimate in space, design, comfort and privacy. David Livingstone famously named Lake Malawi “The Lake Of Stars” and for good reason, during the day the light dances across the deep blue water and once the sun has set the stars twinkle brightly both in the sky but also on the lake as the fishermen light up their hurricane lamps for their night on the lake. Guests can relax on the white sandy beach or enjoy an elevated view of the lake from the stylish infinity pool. For those seeking some activity we offer waterskiing, sailing, kayaking, walks in the hills, sunset cruises on our handbuilt dhow and snorkling and diving. Under water activities never fail to amaze as the diversity of fishlife is very surprising and experts say that this lake is home to more native fish species than any other in the world. Pumulani offers the perfect mix for a memorable holiday. Enjoy being active or simply relax in the beautiful and tranquil scenery. Luxury accommodation, friendly personal service and stunning views over Lake Malawi combine to make Pumulani the perfect African beach lodge. Dutch architect G. Hooft Graafland designed each of the ten villas individually adapting them to their own unique location to ensure they blend harmoniously into their different surroundings. The gently curving lines of the very spacious villas reflect the patterns and movements of the lake along with the interior design, which is directly inspired from the surrounding nature. Each villa has a large bedroom, which opens out onto a private deck where early risers can enjoy the morning’s first rays. The bathrooms also offer splendid views and are well equipped with a bathtub, double shower and double sink, and the spacious lounge area offers further comfort for those wishing to relax in the room. The central area consists of a spacious open restaurant with an undercover area, bar and a cosy fire area. The infinity swimming pool is on a lower terraced deck. Three raised walkways with steps lead off from the central area to the villas and down to the beach. The name Pumulani means “rest well” in the local Chichewa language, and that’s exactly what we offer – the chance to unwind in a beautiful and tranquil setting.
address: Monkey Bay, Lake Malawi National Park 10101 Malawi

name: Tongole Wilderness Lodge
description: Discover Tongole Wilderness Lodge. A luxury eco-lodge nestled deep amongst the breathtaking Miombo woodlands of the 1,800km² Nkhotakota Wildlife Reserve. Tongole is unique in being one of only two lodges in the reserve and the only lodge to boast high-end, luxury accommodation and first class facilities. Nestled in the South East corner of Africa, sandwiched between Zambia and Mozambique: Malawi and the Nkhotakota Wildlife Reserve are your playground. Each experience in the wilderness is unique. Your adventure at Tongole is fully customisable. Whether a first time explorer. Or a veteran of the safari. Your escape is personally tailored to allow you to be as wild or laid back as you wish. Traverse the snaking Bua River on a canoeing adventure. Trek through the rugged wilderness bush with an expert guide. Or if that all sounds too much like hard work, relax in your suites hand-built sunken bath before enjoying a meal under the African star-lit sky. Adventure or relaxation. Whatever your desire it's waiting for you in the wilderness.

roomTips.text: Your stay at Tongole is worth every penny that is paid.

name: Ntchisi Forest Lodge
description: Ntchisi Forest Lodge is a remote eco-lodge in a historial building in a rainforest location with the most stunning view in Malawi. Here you can experience the real Africa, either on one of our many rainforest or mountain hikes, or you can participate in some of our cultural activities in remote rural villages still untouched by tourism. We also arrange volunteering stays, on which you can spend a few days or weeks delving a bit deeper into Malawian culture and feel that you give something back as part of your holiday. The lodge runs enterily on renewable energy and we grow most of our own herbs and vegetables. You can stay in one of the 5 lodge rooms, our newly build Forest Cabin or stay in one of our two luxury tents. Here you can experience the real Africa in comfortable and safe surroundings and with a good conscience.

Our four spacious and modern safari tents are all en-suite, each with a bathtub and an outdoor shower.

name: Kutchire Lodge
description: Kutchire Lodge is located on land that is inside the boundaries of Liwonde National Park Game Reserve. The Game Reserve offers what is perhaps the premiere wilderness/safari experience in Malawi. Over 420 different species of wild life are found here, including vast numbers of hippos, crocodiles, and elephants. The park also features Burchell's zebra, warthog, greater kudu, velvet monkey, baboon, impala, water buck, bush buck, mongoose, and monitor lizards, to name a few. Visitors may also catch a glimpes of black rhinos and lions. We offer an all-inclusive accommodation option, and have a number of rooms to suite your needs ranging from luxury chalets, cosy treehouses, family rooms, dormitories, and camping sites. We are also happy to provide our visitors with access to our wildlife viewing deck that overlooks a branch of the Shire river.

name: Mumbo Island
locationString: Cape Maclear, Lake Malawi National Park
description: Set on a pristine, practically deserted tropical island, the eco-friendly Mumbo Camp is surrounded by crystal-clear waters. Lake Malawi National Park is the first in the world set aside for the protection of freshwater fish and therefore, not surprisingly, one of the best freshwater diving locations on the planet. To set the scene, your accommodation – one of six en-suite tents – is perched on rocks high above the water and shaded by lush foliage. With an idyllic lake view, you can while the hours away on the hammock on your private deck. Refreshments are served in the dining area and pub. Be warned, this lazy island lifestyle is contagious!Did you know?Mumbo Island Camp has partnered with Malawi's Department of National Parks and Wildlife to put an end to illegal fishing operations in this sanctuary.Lake Malawi is Africa's third largest and second deepest lake. Mumbo is just one of the miombo woodland islands that pepper the lake. Your activities include scuba diving and snorkelling, while kayaking and boating allow you to explore the surrounding granitic islands.Over 2 000 species of colourful freshwater fish grace our lake. Spotted-necked otter are often seen while the rarer Cape clawless otter, less so. On the island you can see rainbow skinks and large water monitors. Bird life is abundant, dominated by the ever-present African Fish-Eagles.
address: Mumbo Isand, Malawi, Cape Maclear, Lake Malawi National Park 48 Malawi

name: Kachere Kastle
description: Welcome to Kachere Kastle! After nearly eight years in the build, we are delighted to be open to welcome guests. We are located on a beautiful stretch of sandy beach, on the shores of Lake Malawi; approximately 30km south of Chintheche & 310km north of Lilongwe. We have 12 beautiful, airy & spacious en-suite rooms: six of which are centred around our large pool, & the rest face the lake. Four of the lake facing rooms are tower suites; each with their own lounge. The upper tower suites also have a balcony & a private roof terrace ... where you can sleep under the stars! The castle is centred around a large pool, that has a swim up bar ... there is also a full sized squash court on site, and we have many activities that are free for our guests to use; ranging from windsurfers for the active, to sunloungers for the chillers! Our restaurant offers a variety of delicious home cooked, European style dishes & we happily cater for dietary requirements (many of our dishes are already gluten free). We also have an extensive bar. Day guests are welcome to come for lunch, with a prior booking. We look forward to welcoming you in person. Oh! Did we mention the great campsite? Every group of campers has their own cooking prep area, flood- light, charging socket, basin with running water, barbecue and fire pit. Showers are hot and strong! Warm regards Russ & Kate

name: Mvuu Camp
description: Set amongst large, shady trees along the banks of the surging Shire River, Mvuu Camp offers a charming setting for those wishing to explore the country’s premier wildlife haven. Being Malawi’s largest river, the Shire attracts hordes of mammals and birds. Whether you are staying in one of our 12 attractive en-suite units or in the nearby campsite, you will find the atmosphere lively and dynamic. The impressive thatched dining and lounge area offers magnificent vistas over the river, framed by two large baobab trees. For those wishing to cool off in the midday heat there is an inviting pool. The camp is completed by a traditional boma for dining under the stars. Did you know?Since our inception into Liwonde in 1994, large areas of the Park have been rehabilitated; some 500 local people currently benefit financially from our camps.The diverse landscape includes relatively dry mopane woodlands interspersed with candelabra trees, patches of miombo, palm savannah and numerous baobabs on extensive floodplains and dense riverine vegetation.Your activities will include boating, game drives (day and night) and cultural visits to villages.Mvuu means ‘hippo’ in Tonga, referring to the large numbers that occur here. The Park is also home to elephant, rare black rhino, sable, waterbuck, Lichtenstein’s hartebeest and, rarely, lion.The prolific bird life seen include African Skimmer, Palmnut Vulture and White-backed Night-Heron.
rankingString: #2 of 15 Specialty lodging in Liwonde National Park

name: Chelinda Camp - Central African Wilderness Safaris
description: Chelinda Camp overlooks a crystal-clear dam with views out onto the open grasslands of the High Nyika Plateau. Guests here take meals in the nearby main area, which has a large dining, bar and lounge area complete with comfortable furnishings and an inviting fireplace. From a game viewing perspective, a variety of animals can be seen, particularly in the famous Nyika Grasslands, which harbour important populations of roan, eland, Crawshay's zebra, southern reedbuck, bushbuck, warthog, spotted hyaena and side-striped jackal. Elephant can be seen at times and even leopard can be seen in the daytime owing to the temperate climate. Chelinda's grasslands are famed for their spectacular orchids as well as the 400 bird species that occur in the Nyika National Park - many with highly restricted distributions.

name: Ufulu Gardens
description:
Ufulu Gardens is an excellent choice for travelers visiting Lilongwe, offering a charming environment alongside many helpful amenities designed to enhance your stay.
Rooms at Ufulu Gardens offer air conditioning, a refrigerator, and a kitchenette providing exceptional comfort and convenience, and guests can go online with wifi.
A concierge and room service are some of the conveniences offered at this small hotel. A pool and free breakfast will also help to make your stay even more special. If you are driving to Ufulu Gardens, free parking is available.
Close to some of Lilongwe's most popular landmarks, such as World War I Memorial (1.9 mi) and Kumbali Cultural Village (2.6 mi), Ufulu Gardens is a great destination for tourists.
If you’re looking to experience local food favorites like falafel, consider a visit to Ama Khofi, which is not far from Ufulu Gardens.
Plus, during your trip, don't forget to check out a government building, such as Parliament Building.
Enjoy your stay in Lilongwe!

name: Chelinda Lodge
description: The rolling hills of Nyika, covered in grass and pockets of evergreen forests, seem to belong to another continent. A pocket of hagenia woodland and forest backdrop shelters the idyllic upland Chelinda Lodge, and all its log cabins have sweeping views of the antelope-dotted hills. Wooden walkways link the cabins to the main area, complete with outside deck for sundowners, convivial dining around a fireplace and lounge area for quiet reflection or conversation. The vistas in Nyika are immense, while from a game viewing perspective a variety of animals can be seen around Chelinda Lodge - particularly in the grasslands. Numbers and species vary depending on season and include roan, eland, Crawshay's zebra, southern reedbuck, bushbuck, warthog, spotted hyaena, leopard and side-striped jackal. Even elephant can be seen at times. Birding specials and orchid species add colour and vibrancy to this unique area.

description: ...somewhere along the wild & unexplored Northern lake shore you´ll find this hidden gem, a peaceful oasis, framed by stunning rocks, beautiful beaches and crystal clear water. Welcome to paradise! Usisya Beach Eco-Lodge is designed to fulfill all requirements when it comes to sustainable living, we run our place with solar power, provide a beautiful open-air solar heated shower, a composting toilet with a stunning view, we run a permaculture garden with lifestock, we use our vegetables for our restaurant and use sustainable firewood. we build our place mostly with natural materials and designed it in harmony with our natural surroundings as we like to be enviromental-friendly and to give our guests the most enjoyable experience possible. our place is for nature lovers, bird watchers, divers, for people who enjoy relaxing, swimming, snorkeling, hiking or reading a book in one of our hammocks...

Each room offers air-conditioning, wireless Internet, DStv, M-Net, a 32" HD LCD, intercom facility, complimentary tea and coffee, and international bathroom amenities in the spacious bathrooms.Conferencing is all together a different experience while at Bridgeview Hotel, with a total of three conference rooms accommodating 10 to 130 delegates offering free conference amenities, a PA system and projector with screen, you can worry less and do more while we take care of morning and afternoon tea breaks and mouth-watering buffet lunches or dinners.Our in-house Lemon and Spice Restaurant, open for breakfast, lunch and dinner, will have you coming back to try something different from our a la-carte, Indian and Chinese menu, or simply come browse the net while we offer you the best cappuccino in town. name: Debonairs Pizza
description:
At Steers® Malawi, we serve real smiles and flaming hot welcomes 100% of the time. Since opening our doors, we've become well-known for serving delicious 100% pure beef burgers, tasty flame-grilled and fried chicken, golden hand-cut chips and decadent desserts. And to make sure everyone in Malawi can enjoy our flame-grilled meals, we have halal restaurants. Our restaurants are available in most major cities around the country from Lilongwe to Blantyre and Zomba.
We've partnered up with Total to bring you more convenience, making our flame-grilled meals easily accessible to people on the go. We strive to constantly meet your expectations by serving you real quality food and giving you excellent service and value offerings. Nothing beats Steers® flame-grilled meals!

name: Maji Zuwa Water & Sun Resort
description: Maji Zuwa, meaning “water and sun,” in the local Tumbuka language, is a social entrepreneurship venture encompassing a lodge, conference facilities, community meeting place and non-profit organisation located in Sangilo Village, Chilumba, Karonga District, on the northern beach shores of Lake Malawi. Maji Zuwa hosts travelers who are looking for more than just a typical stop-over. Having the best view of the lake, perched above the azure waters, we offer backpackers and travelers the opportunity to be involved in something bigger than a lodge. Our rooms are clean, simple, and affordable with options ranging from ensuite, to inexpensive dorms, and, of course, camping sites which overlook the water. There are numerous activities with which you can take part while staying with us at Maji Zuwa. In addition to our regular activities such as day trips to Livingstonia, snorkelling or beach volleyball, the staff will always let you know of special events that may be happening that you’d like to do. For example, watching the local high school football match as they play their rivals from the neighbouring town. For those who would like peace and tranquility, you’ll look upon some of the best views of the lake, relaxing in Adirondack chairs where you can kick back and snooze the afternoon away As well as being a lodge and community meeting place, Maji Zuwa is also the home of Determined to Develop (D2D), a non-profit organisation working in Chilumba. D2D works side-by-side with members of the community to address their needs and provide assistance in the overall development of the wider region. Profits from Maji Zuwa go toward the development projects that focus on four areas: education; women’s empowerment; health and nutrition; and environment. As part of our education program, D2D pays school fees for more than 350 girls and boys at both community secondary schools and national boarding schools. Over 40 of these youth, many whom have been orphaned, live with us here on the Maji Zuwa campus (and they are always keen for beach football if you are interested!).

name: Chintheche Inn
description: Chintheche Inn is set in extensive, lush gardens dotted with splendid, shady trees and overlooking Lake Malawi which, oceanlike, stretches to the horizon. The distant Viphya Mountains form a dramatic backdrop. There is a central dining area and bar, and meals often take place (weather permitting) under the stars or in a secluded corner of the garden, near the large swimming pool. Chintheche Inn boasts some of the finest beaches on the lakeside as well as excellent freshwater activities such as boating and snorkelling. Meeting and interacting with the local people, biking through villages and learning about the Chintheche Tree Planting initiative from our staff are just a little of what makes the friendly, laid-back Inn such a unique place to visit. Birdlife is abundant, while the reclusive mutable sun squirrel may be sighted in the gardens.

description: Cape Maclear's funkiest backpacker lodge, situated on the sandy shores of Lake Malawi Description Malambe (Chichewa for baobab) is situated on the sandy beach of Lake Malawi right in the heart of Cape Maclear and offers camping, beach hut and dorm accommodation at great prices. We have a cool bar overlooking the lake towards Thumbe Island serving all drinks (ice cold of course) and a restaurant serving breakfast lunch and dinner. For those who wish to self cater - our large spotlessly clean kitchen is fully equipped with all that is needed to cook up a delicious dinner. The village market is a short walk away and has all that you would expect to find in a local market. Watch out for the early morning fisherman as they come in with their catches - a variety of fresh fish which is great for the BBQ. Malambe is also trying to be environmentally friendly and uses solar power for hot water and for some lighting. Other services at Malambe include wifi internet access, laundry, boat trips, village tours and free use of snorkelling equipment. Be warned - those who stay find it very hard to leave!

locationString: Cape Maclear, Lake Malawi National Park
description: The Warm Heart Adventure Lodge is owned by a Malawian woman called Kay, she is one of three locally owned lodges in Cape Maclear. The lodge is based in a fishing village called Chembe village. The village is alongside the Lake Malawi National park and is a World Heritage Site. Cape Maclear's charm is the beautiful way the fishing village has welcomed tourism and how village and tourism work hand in hand and how they plan to develop and grow together. The Warm Heart Adventure lodge is managed by Kay and her lovely manager Flora. It is a beautifully simple lodge with a warm and friendly team waiting to take care you. It has 5 beach front reed chalets, 1 en-suite self-catered beach front cottage and a 6 person dorm, with a little space in the garden for the odd camper. The Warm Heart Adventure Lodge is also home to Warm Heart Adventures, which is Kay's small adventure tour company that specializes in tailor-made tours around Malawi. The tours are put together and lead by Kay.

name: Kuti Wildlife Reserve
description: Kuti Wildlife Reserve is located in central Malawi. This nation is known as ‘The Warm Heart of Africa’, both for its stunning beauty and friendly people. Kuti is home to a variety of animals native to this area. Although no dangerous predators live here, there are plenty of animals such as zebra, eland, monkeys, giraffe and a great variation of birds. The absence of dangerous game makes the park accessible on foot or by bicycle, which gives you a unique and up-close experience with the bush. ​ Besides sharing the beauty of nature, Kuti Wildlife Reserve is important for the local communities. We raise awareness about ecology and support community projects. By changing local perceptions of wildlife, we hope to preserve wildlife for future generations. ​ Visit Kuti and experience the unique tranquillity of the African bush!

name: Madidi Lodge
description: At Madidi we know that business travelling is not as glamorous as it looks from the outside, we believe that it is our duty to make our guests as comfortable and relaxed as possible. We like to challenge the conventional approach of bland designs and uncharacteristic set ups in order to fit everybody's taste. We feel that all our guests deserve to come 'home' to a place of comfort, relaxation and inspiring surroundings with the facilities that allow to finish off that report or meet colleagues and the opportunity to unwind and regenerate their energy at the end of the day. Madidi you can expect a non-standard and inspiring set up, our services offer travellers comforts and needs such spacious comfortable rooms, FREE WIFI, flexibility on breakfast and dinner times in beautiful and unique surroundings with personalized service. The 13 animal named rooms all have outside areas & balconies and have an African feel to it. Our menu offers a variety of home made comfort food that is prepared with care and attention and with a focus on using fresh local ingredients. The unique and tranquil pool area, gym & spa are designed to offer for some 'me time' and to spoil oneself. We believe that our attention to detail, design and service will make lasting memories. We believe in operating with our environment and community in mind. Where possible, Madidi promotes and supports local businesses and artist, the lodge is a showcase of local artists and we give preference to local suppliers. Furthermore, we aim to keep our carbon footprint as low as possible by recycling grey water, compost green waste and carefully manage the use of water. Madidi is easily accessible from Kamuzu International Airport and from the main roads leading to Blantyre and Lake Malawi. The Axa Bus and National Bus Company which offer transport throughout Malawi, are on walking distance from the lodge.

name: Majete Community Camp Site
description: Near the entrance to the park is a self-catering campsite which was built in 2007 and equipped with a thatched bar and dining space, barbeque area, toilets and hot showers. Power is provided through a solar system and two beautifully thatched hideouts offer a comfortable place to spend the night. The campsite is owned and managed by a Committee of local people from villages surrounding Majete, with assistance from the extension team of African Parks and the profits go directly to them.Shelter There are two purpose built wooden structures which can be hired out to keep off the sun or rain and offer some shelter. There is a double shelter for two tents (please see above) and a single shelter. Hiring Tents It is possible to hire tents at the community campsite. Mattresses, pillows and sheets are provided. During the colder nights it is advisable to bring your own blankets or sleeping bag. Cooking At the campsite there are cooking utensils, pots and pans. Please ask the staff when you arrive for use of these items. There are also braai facilities available and the cost depends on the number of person: If you do not wish to cook for yourself food is available at the Mwembezi Restaurant situated below the Heritage Centre 2 minutes' drive from the camp-site. Menus for the restaurant are available at the main camp-site area. Make sure you let the camp-site staff know and also give the Mwembezi Restaurant advanced notice if you wish to eat dinner or breakfast there. Please do not attempt to walk to the restaurant. Walking unescorted is prohibited in Majete. The main campsite area There are tables and chairs and a cooking area. Soft drinks and beer are sold at the campsite.

name: Mpale Cultural Village
description: Mpale Cultural Village is the first purpose built Cultural Tourism Village designated by the Ministry of Tourism in Malawi.Situated on top of the rocky Chinaphale Hill within Mpale Village in Mangochi, the village offers you the unique opportunity to take a cultural expedition into past and present Yao culture.In the past the area surrounding Mpale Village supported a thriving elephant population, in fact the road leading to Mpale Cultural Village was once a path used by wild elephant herds, en-route to grazing sites. In 2009 under the auspices of the Department of National Parks and Wildlife together with several conservation partners, the elephant population surrounding Mpale were included in a successful program to relocate the animals to Majete Game Reserve in the Lower Shire Valley.The ‘Mangochi Elephants’ as they came to be known are now free to roam majestically within the 75, 00 hectares of Majete’s savannah landscape. All that remains of the elephants at Mpale Cultural Village is the village folklore of ‘Yalidji Ndembo Sitatu’ (The Three Elephants), legend has it that in order to evade capture during the translocation program 3 elephants hid from game rangers in the vast bushes by night and during the day magically transformed into human beings. After successfully evading capture the elephants became over confident and were cornered be a tranquilizer wielding game ranger , knowing that they were about to be captured the smallest elephant pleaded in a human like voice (‘Please don’t shoot us’), astounded by what had just happened the game ranger fled dropping his tranquilizer gun on the spot. Is this true? Find out for yourself, visit Mpale Cultural Village.

name: Welcome Lodge Lilongwe
description: Welcome Lodge Lilongwe, is situated in the Old Town of Malawi's capital city, Lilongwe. Our lodge can be found in Area 3, tucked away from the hustle and bustle of city life; yet within walking distance of essentials such as banks, supermarkets, a variety of restaurants and conference centres. Other amenities and tourist attractions such as The Lilongwe Golf Club, Lilongwe Wildlife Centre, fitness gyms, clothes, food and curio markets and a selection of bars are located close by. Our accommodation caters for all budgets and includes a choice of single or twin en suite rooms, dorm beds or camping grounds.Our scenic camping grounds also provide a quiet, relaxing, picturesque environment, lush with Malawi’s native flora and fauna, perfect for guests who may want to pass their day working outside or relaxing under the beautiful, Malawian sun.

name: Majasi Wildlife Camp
description: Run by people who have travelled and worked all over Africa for 30 years we know what backpackers are looking for in accommodation, pricing and expectation.A traditional style house located in the heart of town and right by the river, we have the best of both worlds. Offering dorm beds, private rooms, tents and powered campsites at reasonable prices with a well stocked menu and bar and great shared spaces to meet other travellers and compare game pictures - you'll be well-fed and entertained.With our experience we'll take you to sniff out all that Liwonde National Park has to offer in either our 4x4, on a game cruise and overnight cruises - something to suit all preferences and all budgets.You'll find in town a number of locally run restaurants and bars and enough street food to give you an introduction to the delights of Malawian food. Depending of the time of the week that you arrive you'll have the option of getting some local produce at either of our markets.

name: Mufatse Lodge & Campsite
description: We are a privately owned local African bed and breakfast lodge and campsite(for backpackers). Mufatse has changed management, its customer service delivery and ethics. As such while the reviews from 2015 to 2017 paint a very dire image of the lodge, we can assure you that, that is a thing of the past now. Reason being that from year 2018 October, Mufatse lodge is now consistently being ran by an Irish trained young local Malawian lady who has vast experience in hospitality and health acquired from years lived in Ireland. Our lodge is housed in a low density surburban area, in a historical bungalow that once played residency for a Zambian diplomat 29 years ago We are located 25 minutes drive from the main airport, we are in the centre of Lilongwe Old town the capital city of Malawi. The lodge location is perfect for tourists and guests who are on a budget as we are literary 5 minutes walk from a shopping mall,forex bureaus, a golf course, major banks,pubs, main curios market in Malawi, lilongwe flea market and the shopping district, and 10 minutes away from the regional police headquarters. Our lodge location proximity makes Mufatse both safe and yet vibrant too. We have 2 private ensuite rooms,3 standard rooms, 2 twin rooms and 3 dorms that are categorised into 3 to fit individuals or groups too (1-4, 1-7, 1-18) . The dorms are provided with or without breakfast to create convinence and flexibility for our money conscious guest as well as a campsite and outdoor kitchen.(utensils can be arranged where needed). Airport shuttle whether by Taxi and tuk tuk can also be arranged at a reasonable price either with trusted taxi drivers or our own 7 seater lodge vehicle when it is not busy. Check in is from 8 am and check out is at 10:30am. We have a restaurant on site, a tuckshop for basics and great professional staff 24hours on site. Currently we do not have a bar on site, but we urge you to visit our partner pub ROSEVINE 4 minutes walk within the neighbourhood where you will be able to listen to local Malawian jazz and enjoy company of making new friends.
address: 3 Lister Avenue Road, Area, Lilongwe Malawi

name: Fisherman's Rest
description: For twenty years Fisherman's Rest has been working alongside its communities in the surrounding schools and villages. It is a thriving not for profit Lodge and Nature Reserve, which employs more than one hundred people from the local community. ​ The vision of the Chichlowscy family is to see the districts around Fisherman's Rest thrive, through communities working together to raise living standards, education and economic opportunity. ​ From Fisherman’s Rest we organise unforgettable holidays. We are able to offer a range of day trips and tours to the famous Lake of Stars, the National Parks and wildlife reserves, using lodges and venues that meet all budgets. We also offer opportunities for individuals and groups to engage with local communities across a wide range of projects in schools, clinics, prisons, orphanages, churches and villages. It is our desire to provide our visitors with an experience that will be cherished for life through the sharing of their energy, time and skills with the communities around us. We long to see improved standards of education, health, farming and housing. ​ We are connected with broadband throughout the site and we are an excellent venue for conferences, workshops and retreats. Nearby is Blantyre city, which is our closest airport.

description: Crown Hotel is one of the best Hotels in Lilongwe capital city of Malawi, it is situated in area 3 in Daud Complex, along Kamuzu Procession road, opposite Maula BP filling station. At Crown Hotel we provide professional services that meet demands of our customers, such as Accommodation, Conferencing and Restaurant. We have 51 rooms with a total capacity of 95 guests in case of sharing. All rooms are fitted with satellite top boxes, air conditioners and mini fridges. We have both standard rooms and executive rooms. Our conference halls are big enough with seating capacity of 150 people. It is fitted with air conditioners and P/A System. We also have LCD Projector and flip chart stands to suit every training and learning sessions if needed. Our restaurant caters 150 guests at one sitting, we serve both alacarte and buffet enabling every guest build good memorable experience and use our services again.

As your “home away from home,” the hotel rooms offer a flat screen TV, air conditioning, and a mosquito net, and getting online is easy, with wifi available.

Enjoy your stay in Zomba!

description: Nthuzi Villas is an upscale start-up Bed and Breakfast located in New Area 43, one of the suburbs in Lilongwe, the capital of Malawi. Area 43 is close to the City Centre, where most of the offices especially international organisations and government offices are located. The neighbourhood provides our clients a suitable environment for both work and holiday. It also provides convenience to access many facilities that maybe of interest to guests including most of the popular restaurants, cafes and bars, and also hospitals as well as tourist attractions such as the Kamuzu mausoleum. The property comprises of newly built twin townhouses with a total of eight rooms, all en-suite. All the rooms are well ventilated and air-conditioned. Guests can enjoy the sun set view from the balcony. The property has back up generators and water tanks for uninterrupted supply of power and water.

Guest rooms offer air conditioning, a minibar, and a refrigerator, and Hucess Executive Lodge makes getting online easy as wifi is available.

If you like Italian restaurants, Hucess Executive Lodge is conveniently located near Mamma Mia Italian Restaurant, Mediterraneo Italian Restaurant, and Vincent's Restaurant.

name: Misty's Lounge (CBR)
description: CBR Misty’s Lounge is a cocoon of comfort of comfort in Mzuzu, one of Malawi’s fastest growing cities. We believe in intimacy and individual care, we want you to feel like family. Come take a load off in our restaurant where you can enjoy an array of our meals, sit at our family style table with loved ones or maybe even meet someone new. Our chef is adept at satisfying all your culinary needs from succulent pork to zesty usipa and nsima. Misty’s has five beautifully furnished rooms each with its own individual flare. Enjoy our Italian room complete with en suite bathroom and a lounge area for your guests. Our Superior room has a classic claw foot tub, perfect for the whimsical romantic in all of us. In Mzuzu for more practical matters? We offer conference services for up to 25 people, a perfect place for small businesses or private corporate retreats.

The bed and breakfast features a 24 hour front desk and room service, and you can stay connected during your stay as Freddies Lodge offers guests internet access. Freddies Lodge looks forward to welcoming you on your visit to Lilongwe.

description: Liwonde Country Lodge is situated 200 meters from the Kamuzu Barrage in Liwonde, South Eastern Malawi. It is just 150 meters away from the banks of the Shire River (home to hundreds of hippos and other big animals) and Seven kilometres from the Liwonde National Park. The lodge opened in 2019 and has 12 rooms all air conditioned comprising of deluxe rooms, studios and family rooms. More rooms are still being constructed. The Lodge has a bar, restaurant, garden, boardroom and conference rooms. It is three and half hours drive from Lilongwe International Airport in the capital city and two hours drive from Chileka International Airport in Blantyre. It is perfect for business and leisure visitors with easy access to different areas of interest. The lodge also works with tour operators in arranging river and boat safaris.

name: Blue Lagoon Lodge Blantyre
description: The Blue Lagoon Lodge is a tranquil oasis nestled just outside the hustle and bustle of the Blantyre city. Relaxing in its lush green gardens or by its bright blue crystal swimming pool will make you forget all your worries and enjoy the holiday. We pride ourselves in catering to individual needs of our guests and offering them personalized service. Our priority is to ensure comfort and security. Our clients will enjoy any of the extra spacious rooms, all with en-suite bathrooms, 2 cozy lounges and a beautiful courtyard with many private spots where you can relax with a refreshing drink and a magazine while your children are busy playing outdoor games or having fun in a supervised pool. There is a conference hall which can be hired for our business clients. Especially for our foreign visitors, we have a brand new computer room available with Wi-Fi connection and long distance phone call facilities. Dining: At the Blue Lagoon, you will have our chef at your service, ready to prepare a fresh scrumptious meal just for you. You can order anything from a traditional English breakfast to any of our traditional Malawian dishes. Suites Both the presidential and deluxe rooms are extra spacious and each has an en-suite bathroom, TV, a mini fridge and a large king size bed with high quality soft linen and fluffy cushions. Closest airport- Chileka International Airport (BLZ) in Blantyre.

name: Matamba Equestrian
description: Tucked away in a beautiful forest is a unique farm stay just 3km from the stunning Malawi lake shore. Enjoy delicious home cooked meals using home grown and locally sourced produce. Learn natural horsemanship and go for a ride or wander by foot through our 40 acres of private forest, being sure to keep watch for any birds. Stay and relax in a private room in the original farmhouse overlooking the stables and unwind to the melodies of farm life in Malawi.
